engagement_descriptions.people_in_recovery_other: speakers at a school sponsored event for parents
engagement_descriptions.subject_matter_experts_other: predominantly school personnel, who work with students and families, at our START (Substance use, Treatment, Awareness and Recovery) meetings.
engagement_descriptions.barriers_people_who_use_drugs: We have not yet sought out people using drugs. I think that might be a difficult population to engage in this community.
engagement_descriptions.barriers_families: we have not yet specifically sought out families impacted by opioids or other substances

disparities_assessment.barriers: This is something we need to look at even though this is an affluent community. There is an assumption that healthcare is available but associated stigma and a diverse pool of service providers is valuable information.

behavioral_health_assessment.admin_data_sources: reviewed documents related to overdose/ response from EMT/Fire
behavioral_health_assessment.barriers: The need to be able to accurately know and understand all the services available in the community and surrounding area.

existing_programs.other_methods: We are in the process of reviewing our resource list of providers, call centers, and treatment centers in the area as well as compiling a database of current services offered in the community and surrounding area that we can tap into. We do not need to initiate or duplicate services.

planning.process: Our municipality conducted its own planning process.

treatment.barriers: we would like to be able to assist residents but do not have a mechanism right now to be able to identify, or self identify, individuals.

recovery_support.barriers: we would like to be able to assist residents in recovery but do not have a mechanism right now to be able to identify, or self identify, individuals.

how_spent: Increase availability of naloxone and other drugs that treat overdoses for first responders, overdose patients, individuals with OUD and their friends and family, schools, community-based organizations, community navigators and outreach workers, persons being released from jail or prison, or the public
Provide training and education regarding naloxone and other drugs that treat overdoses

pregnant_parenting.barriers: We have not addressed this category to date.

additional_comments.general: There is a lot of funding available and a connection with the Care Mass team for assistance would be great.
